column4: How can I install (and get) latest libstdc++5?, Anyone knows ?
sudo apt-get install libstdc++5
sudo apt-get build-essential will install all of the most important packages that you need if you want to compile something
libdc++5 depends upon gcc-3.3-base, also sudo apt-get ?
uh, dependencies should be resolved automatically...
i.e. when you apt-get libstdc++5, it should *automatically* also download whatever else it needs. doesn't it do that?
no it didn't
can you pastebin the output from apt-get please?
also -- are you running edgy? have you run a "sudo apt-get update" recently?
pasted
you need to give me the URL
ok, that means there are problems with the package repository. are you running Edgy?
no clue, just installed Ubuntu-server 6.06 without anything else
ok. 6.06 is Dapper. Edgy is 6.10. they're the codenames for ubuntu versions
wasn't aware there is already 6.10
try running "sudo apt-get update", and then try again installing libstdc++5
indeed, there isn't. it's still beta and unstable. but still some people do run it
if it still doesnt' install, do "sudo apt-get -f install" and see
update seems being ok, but libstdc++5 gives same error
hadn't seem your last message
The sudo apt-get -f install did it
: evrything ok now ! thank you for your help !!
you're welcome
